subject: Russ Mitchell: Complete Coverage Of The Virginia Tech Tragedy
body:

April 17, 
      2007
 
Devastating 
      news out of Blacksburg, 
      Va., where Monday a 
      23-year-old student, Cho Seung-Hui, killed 
      32 students and then himself in what is called the worst shooting 
      massacre in U.S. history. 
      
 
Harry 
      Smith was live from the campus this morning, where he spoke with hero student Zach Petkewicz, 
      who, along with two fellow students, barricaded the door to 
      their classroom, probably saving the lives of everyone in the room. 
      Harry also spoke with Prof. Scott Hendricks, who witnessed 
      the tragedy. 
 
Julie 
      Chen spoke to criminal profiler Pat Brown to get an idea of signs to look for to avoid 
      such disasters. Lou Dobbs gave us his commentary on the prevalence of 
      school violence. Hattie Kauffman met with Dr. Ronald Stephens, 
      executive director of national school safety, and gave us a look at campus 
      safety and what parents should keep in mind when 
      visiting potential schools. Dr. Phil stopped by to share his advice 
      on where to go from here. 
      
 
Tune 
      in tomorrow as we continue to inform you of the latest 
      developments from Virginia Tech, or check CBSNews.com 
      any time. 
 
Take 
      care,

Russ
